trans-unit.source: Error during fetching content from url "%s": %s
Error during fetching content from url "%s". The content contains frame tags, which is not allowed.
Please select a mail folder or page in the page tree.
The HTML content does not contain any mail boundaries.
The plain text content does not contain any mail boundaries.
Please select at least one recipient group.
There are no recipients in the selected group(s).
There are no recipients in the selected combination of recipient group(s)/exclude group(s).
The mail "%s" was successfully scheduled for distribution at %s.
There are no pages in the mail module.
Save mail settings for recurring mailings
Do not send mail to email addresses found in one of the following recipient groups
Select recipients and time of sending

Here you have to select at least one recipient group and the time of distribution. After pressing FINISH, the mail will be added to the mail queue. There it is possible to delete it before the final sending is finished.
The mail "%s" was successfully saved as draft for recurring sending within the scheduler.
The mail "%s" was successfully scheduled for distribution at %s.
Select a recipient group for the test mail.

Here you can (optionally) send a simple test mail to one or more recipients, before you schedule the final sending on the NEXT page. Beware: The generated mail will include ALL elements regardless of their categories. User fields will NOT be substituted with data.

Content elements with assigned categories will appear in mails only if a recipient has assigned the same category in his profile. Content elements without category restrictions will appear for in all mails.
Enter data and click NEXT to continue.
Click NEXT at the page of your choice to continue.
Enter data and click NEXT to continue.

A newsletter is basically a regular TYPO3 page which resides in the mail folder. Clicking on this link will lead you to a combined page creation and first content element creation form. After creating the page, you may add more content to it.
You may personalize the mails that will be sent to each recipient by inserting the following markers in content elements of the newsletter page. The markers will be substituted with the corresponding value found in each recipient record, whenever available:
###USER_uid### (the unique id of the recipient) ###USER_name### (full name) ###USER_firstname### (first name calculated) ###USER_NAME### and ###USER_FIRSTNAME### will insert uppercase versions of the equivalents ###USER_title### ###USER_email### ###USER_phone### ###USER_www### ###USER_address### ###USER_company### ###USER_city### ###USER_zip### ###USER_country### ###USER_fax### ###MAIL_RECIPIENT_SOURCE### ###MAIL_ID### ###MAIL_AUTHCODE###
Import CSV into tt_address database table
Filter email dublettes from csv data. If a dublette is found, only the first entry is imported.
Only update/import valid emails from csv data.
Field encapsulation character (data fields are encapsed with...)
First row of import file contain field names
Assign the following categories to all recipients
Please select the character set of the import file
No mapping is found. You have to map at least "email" field.
Specify the field which determines the uniqueness of imported users
Remove all Addresses in the storage folder before importing
Field delimiter (data fields are separated by...)
Please select the storage folder for the addresses to be imported.
Choose a csv file from your local computer
CSV export failed. Insufficient access right.
CSV export failed. No recipients found.
CSV export failed. No recipient source configuration found.
CSV of recipients of returned mails
CSV of returned recipients with error in header
CSV of returned recipients with bad host
CSV of returned recipients with mailbox full
CSV of returned recipients for unknown reason
CSV of returned recipients with unknown recipient
Disable returned recipients with error in header
Disable returned recipients with bad host
Disable returned recipients with mailbox full
Disable returned recipients for unknown reason
Disable returned recipients with unknown recipient
Returned recipients with error in header
There are currently no mails in the queue.
If TYPO3 is not configured to send mails with the mail:mass-mailing command controller, you can trigger a manually sending by click on the following button. With every click %s mails will be sent.
You do not have permissions to write configuration to page %s.
The configuration was successfully saved to the selected page %s.
Open mails are not affected by most changes!
Draft mails are not affected by most changes!
No changes in the configuration detected.
The configuration was not saved to the selected page %s.
List of fields used in the calculation of the authentication code included in unsubscribe links and jump URL's of mails.
This email address will appear as the originating address or sender address in the mails received by the recipients.
This name will appear as the name of the author or sender in the mails received by the recipients.
Set this option if you want to embed images in HTML mails.

If the option is set, images are encoded and embed into the messages. Sent messages will be heavier to transport. If the option is not set, images are included in HTML content by absolute reference (href) to their location on the site where they reside.
If set and if redirect is set, all links in plain text content will be redirected, not only links longer than 76 characters.
Enter the name of the sending organization.
The name of the organization will appear in the headers of the mails sent to subscribers.
The delivery priority will be set in the headers of the mails sent to subscribers.
Enter the email address to which replys are sent. (Optional)
If no reply address is specified, the sender email address will be used.
Enter the name of the 'Reply To' email address. (Optional)
If no reply name is specified, the sender name will be used.
Enter the return path email address here.

This is the address to which non-deliverable mails will be returned to. If you put in the marker ###XID### it'll be substituted with the unique id of the mail recipient. Note that if PHP is executing in safe mode, the mail module may not be able to set the return path to a value different than the value defined at the server level.
Select the format of mail content.
If in doubt, set it to 'Plain text and HTML'. The messages will then be sent with both formats included, and the recipients are normally able to select their preferred format.
Type of source of the mail
The mail may be compiled from a page extracted from the page tree of the TYPO3 site: 'TYPO3 Page', or from a page from another site: 'External URL'.
Redirect long links found in plain text content.
If set, links longer than 76 characters found in plain text content will be redirected: long URL's will be replaced by a /redirect-[hash] url handled by the TYPO3 redirect module.
Enter the additional URL parameters used to fetch the HTML content from a TYPO3 page.
The specified parameters will be added to the URL used to fetch the HTML content of the mail from a TYPO3 page. If in doubt, leave it blank.
Default character set for mails built from external pages
Specify the character set used in mails when they are built from external pages and character set cannot be auto-detected.
Select the default content transfer encoding of mails.
If mail content is protected by HTTP authentication, enter the password here.
If mail content is protected by HTTP authentication, enter the username here.

The username and password is used to fetch mail content. They are NOT sent in the mail! If you do not specify a username and password and the mail pages happen to be protected, an error will occur and no mail content will be fetched.
Set this option, to anonymize click tracking.
Content transfer encoding and character set
This feature requires the installation of EXT:jumpurl
Check this option to enable tracking of clicks.
Check this option to enable click tracking for mailto links.
Enter the additional URL parameters used to fetch the plain text content from a TYPO3 page.
The specified parameters will be added to the URL used to fetch the plain text content of the mail from a TYPO3 page. If in doubt, set it to '&plain=1'.
Specify the character set to use when sending quick mails.
Select the content transfer encoding to use when sending quick mails.
If mail content is protected by Frontend user authentication, enter the user group here.

The usergroup with the uid specified is used to to fetch the mail content. If you do not specify a usergroup uid and the page has frontend user restrictions, an error will occur and no mail content will be fetched.
Comma separated list of test recipients (recipient group uids)
Alternatively to send test-mails to individuals, you can send it to this groups.
Comma separated list of test recipients (tt_address uids)
Alternatively to send test-mails to individuals, you can send it to this addresses.
Will be prepended to test mails subject
Send per click (only valid for manual trigger)
This is the number of mails send per click if someone uses the manual trigger in the queue module.
Automatic refresh of delivery progress bars in seconds
You don't have permissions to change mail settings.
URL or IP of the mail server
Port number of the mail server
Number of bounce mail to be processed
Maximum number of bounce mail to be processed on one scheduler cycle
Connection using the given data is failed. Error message
